requirement_tested: Create a homepage displaying general office information and a welcome message
user_persona: A new patient looking for basic information about the clinic.
user_goal: To quickly find the clinic's contact details and understand its purpose.

narrative_steps.title: Visiting the Homepage
narrative_steps.description: Sarah opens her browser and types in the clinic's URL. She lands on the homepage and immediately sees a welcoming design with a light cyan background and cadet blue text.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the homepage URL.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The homepage loads with the office logo, a welcome message stating 'Welcome to our Clinical Office, where your health is our priority.', and office details below it.

narrative_steps.title: Reading Office Information
narrative_steps.description: Sarah scrolls down to read more about the clinic. As she scrolls, additional content fades in smoothly, showing more highlights about the office.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the homepage.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional office highlights or testimonials fade into view smoothly without any abrupt changes.

requirement_tested: Implement an 'About Us' page with details about the clinical office and its mission
user_persona: A prospective patient curious about the clinic's values and team.
user_goal: To learn about the clinic's mission and meet the healthcare professionals.

narrative_steps.title: Navigating to About Us
narrative_steps.description: After browsing the homepage, Sarah wants to know more about the clinic. She clicks on the 'About Us' link in the navigation menu.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'About Us' link in the navigation bar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'About Us' page loads, displaying a section titled 'About Our Office' with the mission statement and other descriptive content.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Team Member Details
narrative_steps.description: Sarah notices photos of the medical staff and decides to click on one to learn more about a particular doctor.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a team member photo.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal pops up showing the selected team member's professional biography.

requirement_tested: Develop a 'Services' page listing all medical services offered by the office
user_persona: A patient seeking specific medical care options available at the clinic.
user_goal: To explore the range of medical services offered without leaving the current page.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Services Page
narrative_steps.description: Curious about what treatments are available, Sarah navigates to the 'Services' page from the main menu.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Services' link in the navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'Services' page loads with a grid-based layout showcasing individual service cards, each containing an icon, name, and brief description fetched from the backend.

narrative_steps.title: Exploring Service Details
narrative_steps.description: While browsing the services, Sarah hovers over a card to see if there's more interaction possible. She then clicks on a service card to get more information.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a service card, then click on it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: On hover, the card elevates slightly with a shadow effect. On click, the card expands to reveal more detailed information without navigating away.

requirement_tested: Build a 'Contact Us' page with a form for users to submit inquiries and office contact details
user_persona: A patient ready to book an appointment and needing to send a message.
user_goal: To fill out a contact form and submit an inquiry to the clinic.

narrative_steps.title: Going to Contact Page
narrative_steps.description: Ready to reach out, Sarah clicks on the 'Contact' link in the navigation menu to go to the contact page.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Contact' link in the navigation menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The 'Contact Us' page loads with a two-column layout: a contact form on the left and a map plus contact info on the right.

narrative_steps.title: Filling and Submitting Form
narrative_steps.description: Sarah fills in her details in the contact form. While typing, she notices that the focused field gets highlighted with a cadet blue border. After filling everything, she submits the form.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in the contact form fields and click the submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Fields highlight with a cadet blue border when focused. Upon submission, a success or error message appears inline below the form.

requirement_tested: Design a consistent navigation menu across all pages for easy access to main sections
user_persona: A frequent visitor who knows what they're looking for but appreciates ease of navigation.
user_goal: To navigate seamlessly between different sections of the website.

narrative_steps.title: Using Navigation Menu
narrative_steps.description: While reading the homepage, John remembers he wanted to check the services. He moves his cursor over the navigation menu items and clicks on 'Services'.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over menu items and click on 'Services'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Menu items change background to a lighter shade of cyan on hover. Clicking 'Services' navigates to the services page.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Mobile Menu Toggle
narrative_steps.description: Later, John views the site on his phone. He taps the menu toggle icon since the full menu isn't visible.
narrative_steps.action: Click the menu toggle icon on a small screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A mobile-friendly dropdown menu overlay opens, allowing easy access to all main sections.

requirement_tested: Apply a light cyan background color to all pages
user_persona: A user sensitive to bright colors who prefers soft backgrounds.
user_goal: To have a visually comfortable experience across the entire website.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Different Pages
narrative_steps.description: Emily visits multiple pages of the website—home, about, services, and contact—to gather information about the clinic.
narrative_steps.action: Visit each main page of the website.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each page consistently displays a light cyan background (#E0FFFF) regardless of the content or device used.

requirement_tested: Style all UI components using a cadet blue color scheme
user_persona: A user who appreciates cohesive and professional-looking websites.
user_goal: To experience a unified visual style throughout the website.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with UI Elements
narrative_steps.description: While exploring the site, Mark interacts with various UI elements like buttons and links, noticing their consistent styling.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over buttons and interactive elements.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All UI components use cadet blue (#5F9EA0). Buttons and interactive elements darken slightly on hover while maintaining the same base hue.

requirement_tested: Ensure all pages are responsive and accessible on different device sizes
user_persona: A busy parent checking the clinic's info on a tablet while waiting at school pickup.
user_goal: To easily navigate and read content on a tablet without horizontal scrolling or tiny text.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing Browser Window
narrative_steps.description: Lisa resizes her browser window to simulate how the site looks on smaller devices.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the browser window to various widths.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Layout adjusts fluidly between breakpoints, reorganizing content stacks vertically on small screens, ensuring readability and usability.

requirement_tested: Set up frontend to fetch any dynamic content via backend APIs if needed
user_persona: A developer verifying that the frontend properly consumes backend data.
user_goal: To confirm that dynamic content is fetched correctly from backend endpoints.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dynamic Content
narrative_steps.description: When visiting the services page, the frontend must fetch the list of services from the backend API.
narrative_steps.action: Load the Services page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Upon DOMContentLoaded, scripts automatically initiate API requests to '/api/services' and populate the service cards dynamically.

requirement_tested: Configure backend to connect to PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A system administrator deploying the application.
user_goal: To ensure the backend successfully connects to the PostgreSQL database using correct environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Server
narrative_steps.description: The administrator starts the backend server and checks logs for successful database connection messages.
narrative_steps.action: Start the backend server process.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The backend initializes a secure connection to the PostgreSQL database using host=localhost, port=5432, username=myappuser, password=myapppassword, and database=myapp.

requirement_tested: Initialize repository structure with separate directories for frontend and backend
user_persona: A developer setting up the project locally for the first time.
user_goal: To clone and set up the project with clearly separated frontend and backend code.

narrative_steps.title: Cloning Repository
narrative_steps.description: Mike clones the repository and inspects the folder structure to begin development.
narrative_steps.action: Clone the repository and inspect root directory contents.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The project root contains two main folders: 'frontend/' for client-side assets and 'backend/' for server logic, promoting clean separation of concerns.

requirement_tested: Configure package.json with install:all script to set up both frontend and backend dependencies
user_persona: A new contributor joining the development team.
user_goal: To quickly install all necessary dependencies for both frontend and backend.

narrative_steps.title: Installing Dependencies
narrative_steps.description: Anna has just cloned the repo and wants to set up her local environment by installing all dependencies.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run install:all` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend dependencies are installed concurrently using the command: concurrently "cd frontend && npm install" "cd backend && npm install".

requirement_tested: Add dev script in package.json to run both frontend and backend concurrently
user_persona: A developer beginning daily work on the project.
user_goal: To start both frontend and backend servers with a single command for development.

narrative_steps.title: Running Development Servers
narrative_steps.description: Tom begins his day by starting the development environment so he can test recent changes.
narrative_steps.action: Run `npm run dev` from the root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend build watcher and backend server launch together in parallel terminal sessions using the command: concurrently "cd frontend && npm start" "cd backend && npm run start-server".

requirement_tested: Include static asset handling for images, stylesheets, and client-side JavaScript
user_persona: A frontend developer adding new assets to the project.
user_goal: To store and reference static assets efficiently within the project.

narrative_steps.title: Adding New Assets
narrative_steps.description: Jill needs to add a new stylesheet and some images for an upcoming feature update.
narrative_steps.action: Place new assets in appropriate directories under /public/assets/.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Assets placed in /public/assets/images/, /public/assets/styles/, and /public/assets/js/ are served statically by the web server, enabling efficient caching and direct linking.

requirement_tested: Implement SEO-friendly page titles and meta descriptions for each page
user_persona: An SEO specialist optimizing the clinic's online presence.
user_goal: To improve the clinic's visibility in search engine results.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Page Metadata
narrative_steps.description: The SEO specialist reviews each page to verify that unique and relevant metadata is present.
narrative_steps.action: Inspect the <head> section of each page.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each page incorporates distinct SEO metadata including <title> and <meta name="description"> tags populated with relevant keywords and summaries, enhancing crawlability and organic reach.
